channel.title: My run for my client is fucked up
channel.description: [shadow=red,left]I dont know what to do :( please help.[/shadow] [IMG]http://i1117.photobucket.com/albums/k583/samuelganter/ss.png[/img]

item.title: My run for my client is fucked up
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:31, topic:399545”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=496675.msg3638044#msg3638044 date=1308738658]

why u mad bro?

nice come back bro, sounds to me like YOU are mad, because you ran out of things to say, i don’t blame you, your 9 year old mind can go so far :rolleyes:

Remember Pokenation? That was all you said to me.
[/quote]
I remember Pokenation, dead now.

Mexican

Thats all you would say to me, but the funny part was i wasn’t and never will be a mexican.[/quote]

We good now?

Read full topic
item.source: My run for my client is fucked up

item.title: My run for my client is fucked up
item.dc:creator: @tchandle tchandle
item.description:
@tchandle wrote:

Lmao at this thread irl.
Anyways…

Try one of these:

start javaW -Xmx512m Gui -cp .;Theme.jar client exit

or…

@echo off java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui pause

or…

@echo off Title Client START java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 exit

At LEAST one of those should work. Haha. I really enjoyed reading through the comments on this thread. >.<

Read full topic

item.source: My run for my client is fucked up

item.title: My run for my client is fucked up
item.dc:creator: @Tobbescape Tobbescape
item.description:
@Tobbescape wrote:

Ok I’ll post a few you can try.

[code]@echo off
title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

[/code]

[code]@echo off
title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

[/code]

[code]@echo off
title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_yourjavaversion\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

[/code]

[code]@echo off
title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_yourjavaversion\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

[/code]
Good luck mate

Read full topic

item.title: My run for my client is fucked up
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:22, topic:399545”][quote author=judostar1 link=topic=496675.msg3635079#msg3635079 date=1308532479]
cause I fucken hate vain. And when I clearly explained what to do, this kid comes up out of nowhere and calls everyone fucken retarded.
[/quote]
You were explaining that you need it to find jdk, not fucking jre, thats why.

what jdk you have is what you put in after the jdk_1.6.0

to your current jdk version

Then you must download JDK!!! (java programer type file)

The development kit is for developers, which contains javac.exe, which is whats used to compile java filess into byte code the computer can read, made into class files, and it matters if its 64 or 32 bit, not windows xp, vista, or 7…

Yet I’m the kid.
And i can see why you hate him, because you come out spewing all this bullshit, he proves you wrong, then you go cry about it.

And whoever said i was talking about you? I was talking about all the skiddies in this thread who are pr0 s3rb3r c0du4raz
Apparently, you’re one of them.

If this topic is resolved, in that case, let it die.[/quote]

Well vain wasn’t the only one right here lolz

item.title: My run for my client is fucked up
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

Look, I just finished 4 hours of freaken coding. Look. C:Program Files(x86)/ is a vista and/or a windows 7 type.

simply take the (x86) off if you have windows xp, then change it to your java version. Access this by going to C: then to program files, then to java. what jdk you have is what you put in after the jdk_1.6.0

Then change this to your current jdk version, explained at top ^.

Then you must download JDK!!! (java programer type file)

Read full topic
